metadata.title: Neon Ramen Quest
metadata.author: Generated
metadata.description: You're drunk in Tokyo's Kabukicho district with trains stopping soon. Find morning ramen to cure your hangover while navigating neon-lit streets and solving the mysteries of sentient vending machines.

rooms.name: Kabukicho Main Street
rooms.description: You stumble along the neon-drenched main drag of Kabukicho, Tokyo's infamous red-light district. Bright signs flash overhead in Japanese and broken English, advertising everything from karaoke to questionable entertainment. The street buzzes with late-night energy despite the approaching last train. A narrow alley leads east, while the street continues north and south.

rooms.name: Shinjuku Station Entrance
rooms.description: The massive Shinjuku Station looms before you, its entrances still bustling with late-night commuters. A digital clock displays the ominous countdown to the last train. You can hear the rumble of trains below, but more importantly, you catch a whiff of something delicious from the north.

rooms.name: Station Platform
rooms.description: The underground platform is crowded with tired salarymen and party-goers heading home. The last train won't leave for another hour, giving you time for your ramen quest. A vending machine hums mysteriously in the corner.

rooms.name: 24-Hour Konbini
rooms.description: A typical Japanese convenience store blazes with fluorescent light. Rows of onigiri, instant ramen, and strange drinks line the shelves. The bored clerk barely glances up from his manga. This isn't the ramen you're looking for, but there might be useful supplies here.

rooms.name: Back Alley
rooms.description: A dimly lit alley behind the convenience store, filled with the smell of garbage and mystery. A rusty door marked 'Staff Only' is set into the wall. Strange sounds echo from deeper in the alley to the west.

rooms.name: Delivery Area
rooms.description: A small loading dock where trucks deliver supplies to the nearby businesses. Empty boxes and crates are stacked everywhere. A metal ladder leads up to a fire escape.

rooms.name: Fire Escape
rooms.description: You're on a narrow metal fire escape overlooking the neon chaos below. From here you can see across the rooftops of Kabukicho. A window leads into what looks like an office building.

rooms.name: Dark Office
rooms.description: You've climbed through the window into a small, dark office. Moonlight streams through venetian blinds, casting shadows across scattered papers and a desk. The office door leads out to a hallway.

rooms.name: Office Hallway
rooms.description: A sterile office hallway with flickering fluorescent lights. Doors line both sides, but most are locked. An elevator at the end appears to be out of order. Stairs lead down to the ground floor.

rooms.name: Building Lobby
rooms.description: The lobby of a small office building, dimly lit by emergency lighting. A security desk sits unmanned, and glass doors lead back out to the street. You can exit to the east.

rooms.name: Narrow Alley
rooms.description: A cramped alley between buildings, barely wide enough for one person. Pipes and cables run along the walls overhead. The alley opens up to the north, and you can return to the main street west.

rooms.name: Small Plaza
rooms.description: A tiny plaza tucked between buildings, with a few benches and a small fountain that's been turned off for the night. A ramen cart sits in the corner, but it's closed and locked. The plaza continues north.

rooms.name: Shrine Entrance
rooms.description: A small Shinto shrine squeezed between modern buildings, its red torii gate illuminated by a single lantern. Despite the urban chaos around it, the shrine feels peaceful and timeless. Stone steps lead up to the main shrine area.

rooms.name: Shrine Grounds
rooms.description: The small shrine grounds are surprisingly serene. A wooden donation box sits before the main shrine building. An old priest sweeps the grounds despite the late hour, humming quietly to himself.

rooms.name: Ramen Yokocho
rooms.description: You've found the legendary Ramen Yokocho! This narrow alley is lined with tiny ramen stalls, each barely big enough for a few customers. Most are closed, but one at the end still has its lantern lit. The aroma of tonkotsu broth fills the air.

rooms.name: Master Takeshi's Ramen Stall
rooms.description: The last open ramen stall in the alley, run by an elderly master who's been serving ramen here for decades. Steam rises from bubbling pots of broth. However, the master looks troubled - he's missing his special ingredient for the morning ramen.

rooms.name: Pachinko Plaza
rooms.description: A small plaza dominated by the flashing lights and cacophonous sounds of a 24-hour pachinko parlor. Steel balls clatter endlessly inside. A few dedicated players sit zombie-like at their machines despite the late hour.

rooms.name: Inside Pachinko Parlor
rooms.description: The interior of the pachinko parlor is a sensory assault of flashing lights, electronic sounds, and cigarette smoke. Rows of machines stretch into the distance. Near the entrance, you notice a prize counter with various items.

rooms.name: Hidden Courtyard
rooms.description: A secret courtyard hidden behind the buildings, accessible only through narrow passages. In the center stands an ancient vending machine that seems to glow with an otherworldly light. Local legends say it dispenses more than just drinks to those who know the right combination.

objects.name: neon sign
objects.description: A massive neon sign advertising 'Midnight Ramen - Best in Tokyo!' in flickering Japanese characters.
objects.examine_text: The sign flickers hypnotically, and you notice small text at the bottom: 'Secret ingredient: tears of joy from satisfied customers.'

objects.name: drunk salaryman
objects.description: A heavily intoxicated businessman in a rumpled suit, swaying dangerously near a lamppost.
objects.examine_text: He mumbles something about 'the magic coins' and points vaguely toward the station before nearly falling over.

talk.message: The salaryman slurs: 'Psst... the vending machine... it wants... 500 yen coins... three of them... but not just any coins... special ones...' He then passes out standing up.

objects.name: digital clock
objects.description: A large digital display showing the current time and countdown to the last train.
objects.examine_text: The clock shows you have about an hour before the last train. Plenty of time for ramen if you can find the right place.

objects.name: vending machine
objects.description: An ordinary-looking vending machine, but something about it seems different. It hums with an unusual frequency.
objects.examine_text: Looking closer, you notice a small slot that accepts exactly three 500 yen coins. There's a faded label: 'Special Delivery Service.'

use.message: You insert the three special 500 yen coins. The machine whirs to life and dispenses a small wrapped package with a note: 'Deliver to Master Takeshi for the finest ramen experience.' Inside is a small vial of golden liquid labeled 'Essence of Umami.'

objects.name: umami essence
objects.description: A small vial of golden liquid that seems to shimmer with its own light.
objects.examine_text: The label reads 'Pure Essence of Umami - The Fifth Taste.' This must be what Master Takeshi needs for his special morning ramen.

objects.name: instant ramen
objects.description: A cup of cheap instant ramen. Not what you're looking for, but it might be useful.
objects.examine_text: Standard convenience store ramen. The back has a promotion: 'Collect 3 for special prize!' There's a small 500 yen coin taped to the bottom.

objects.name: energy drink
objects.description: A can of Japanese energy drink with incomprehensible ingredients listed on the side.
objects.examine_text: The drink promises to 'restore vitality and clear thinking.' A 500 yen coin is attached as a promotional offer.

objects.name: rusty door
objects.description: A heavy metal door marked 'Staff Only' with multiple locks.
objects.examine_text: The door has three different locks, but they all look like they use the same key. There's a small sign: 'Authorized Personnel Only - Master Key Required.'

objects.name: scattered papers
objects.description: Various documents and papers scattered across the office desk.
objects.read_text: Most papers are boring office memos, but one catches your eye: 'Security Protocol - Master key hidden in shrine donation box for emergency access. Remember: three coins unlock the ancient wisdom.'

objects.name: donation box
objects.description: A traditional wooden donation box at the shrine, with a small slot for coins.
objects.examine_text: The donation box is old and weathered. There's something rattling inside besides coins.

objects.name: master key
objects.description: A heavy brass key with an ornate design.
objects.examine_text: This key looks like it could open multiple locks. There's an engraving: 'Universal Access - Handle with Care.'

objects.name: old priest
objects.description: An elderly Shinto priest tending to the shrine despite the late hour.
objects.examine_text: The priest nods at you knowingly. 'The donation box serves many purposes,' he says cryptically.

talk.message: The priest smiles: 'Young one, the shrine provides for those in need. Check the donation box - sometimes what goes around, comes around. And remember, the ancient machine requires offerings of equal value.'

objects.name: Master Takeshi
objects.description: An elderly ramen master with decades of experience, but he looks troubled tonight.
objects.examine_text: Master Takeshi has kind eyes but worried expression. He keeps looking at his empty ingredient shelf.

talk.message: Master Takeshi sighs: 'Welcome, young one. I would love to serve you my famous morning ramen, but I'm missing my special ingredient - the essence of umami. Without it, my ramen is just ordinary noodles in broth.'

give.message: Master Takeshi's eyes light up as you hand him the umami essence! 'Incredible! This is exactly what I needed!' He quickly prepares the most amazing bowl of ramen you've ever seen. 'This will cure any hangover and restore your spirit. You have found the true treasure of Kabukicho!'

objects.name: recipe book
objects.description: Master Takeshi's personal recipe book, worn from years of use.
objects.read_text: The book is filled with ramen recipes, but the page for 'Morning Cure Ramen' has a note: 'Secret ingredient required - essence of umami. Legend says the ancient vending machine holds the key, but it requires three special coins as offering.'

objects.name: ancient vending machine
objects.description: This vending machine looks far older than the others, with an otherworldly glow emanating from within.
objects.examine_text: The machine has strange symbols carved into its metal surface. There's a coin slot that specifically requires three 500 yen coins, and a note: 'Offerings of equal value unlock ancient wisdom.'

use.message: You insert the three 500 yen coins you collected. The ancient machine glows brighter and with a mystical hum, it dispenses a small package. Inside is a note directing you to the mysterious vending machine at the station platform, along with three special golden coins.

objects.name: prize counter
objects.description: A counter displaying various prizes that can be won with pachinko balls.
objects.examine_text: Among the usual prizes, you notice a special 500 yen coin marked 'Lucky Coin - Limited Edition.' It costs 100 pachinko balls, but the attendant is asleep.

take.message: You quietly take the lucky 500 yen coin while the attendant sleeps. Now you have all three special coins needed!

win_condition.win_message: Congratulations! You've successfully completed your late-night ramen quest in Kabukicho! Master Takeshi's legendary morning ramen has cured your hangover and restored your spirit. As you slurp the perfect noodles, you realize you've not only found the best ramen in Tokyo, but you've also discovered the magic that exists in the hidden corners of the city. The trains can wait - this moment is perfect.
